meanings.sent1: She used a match to ignite the candle.
meanings.sent2: The campfire will ignite easily with some kindling.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to ignite the entire stage!
meanings.sent4: His passionate speech ignited a spark in the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display will ignite the night sky with color.

meanings.sent1: The dry leaves can easily ignite in the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The old building is a fire hazard and could ignite at any moment.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a spontaneous dance party seemed to ignite excitement in the group.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to ignite a fire of determination within him.
meanings.sent5: The spark from the bonfire managed to ignite the nearby bushes.

meanings.sent1: The paper quickly began to ignite when placed in the flame.
meanings.sent2: The dry wood will ignite easily with a bit of kindling.
meanings.sent3: The chef's special sauce seemed to ignite a fiery sensation in his mouth.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to ignite the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The sparklers will ignite in a shower of sparks during the celebration.
